alert.note: Alert for Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 12:08AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following county, Hocking. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1207 AM EST, Department of transportation reported high water on area roadways in southern Hocking County due to earlier rainfall. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Logan, Nelsonville, Hocking Hills State Park, Starr, Laurelville, Murray City, Adelphi, Ilesboro, Lake Logan State Park, Union Furnace, Gibisonville, Haydenville, South Bloomingville, Carbon Hill and Oreville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
